body: That should definitely work. What version of Active Admin are you using?
We're on 5.1 at the moment.  Planning to upgrade ASAP, but have to work out some issues with our CanCan stuff first.
In the example you gave, of 68 showing up instead of 62, can you think of anything in your model that would generate that unexpected number? For example, does it happen to be the record ID?

You might be on to something... Release 62 has an ID of 56, but Release 68 (the one shown in the breadcrumb) has an ID of 62. There aren't any other integers that would display like that in the model:

``` ruby
Release(id: integer, title: integer, release_date: date, summary: text, created_at: datetime, updated_at: datetime, slug: string, pub_status: string, marketplace_improvements: text, manager_improvements: text, devcenter_improvements: text, api_improvements: text, subsection_headings: text)
```

I wonder if we should change title to be a string rather than an integer.  I might try that tonight if I have a chance.

Edit: Just changed the title column to type string and there was no change in the behavior of the breadcrumb.

[This file](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/blob/9339da6cfe9895f7a9cc2a922f4056f1296856f9/lib/active_admin/view_helpers/display_helper.rb) is what's used to determine the display name. Perhaps a little sleuthing is in order:

``` ruby
module ActiveAdmin
  module ViewHelpers
    module DisplayHelper
      alias original_display_method display_name_method_for
      def display_name_method_for(resource)
        method = original_display_method(resource)
        puts "---- found #{method} for #{resource}"
        method
      end
    end
  end
end
```
awesome, I appreciate the pointer. I will dig into this and let you know if I figure it out!

I am also having this problem. I have the models Store and StoreHour that is setup as a one-to-many relationship. When editing a StoreHour A that belongs to Store B, the breadcrumb displays  "Admin / Store Hours / Store B / ". A quick peek, shows that the breadcrumb is pulling the Store name that has the same id as StoreHour A, instead of using the current name for Store A.

Store A (id=1)
Store B (id=2) -> StoreHour A (id=1)

When editing StoreHourA the breadcrumb displays the name for StoreA.

Using ActiveAdmin v0.6.0
Thought I should point out that the breadcrumb code on master has changed a lot, and the changes might solve your problem.

Thanks, I'll take a look and see if it fixes my issue.

Yeah baby! Sent from my iPhone5

On Jun 12, 2013, at 6:20 PM, Sean Linsley notifications@github.com wrote:

> Thought I should point out that the breadcrumb code on master has changed a lot, and the changes might solve your problems.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

I'm actually seeing this and have no idea why.

I have an `Event` that has a `Survey` in a belongs_to relationship. In my case, both the Event and the Survey have a `name` property. In 'View', the breadcrumbs show the parent name and the model name correctly, and the title is the name of the survey. However, in 'Edit', the last item of the breadcrumbs is an Event name. In one survey, it is the name of the parent event, but in another survey (owned by the same event), it's the name of a different event to which the survey is in no way related. In neither case does breadcrumbs use the actual name of the survey on the 'Edit' page.

Fun Fact: putting bread in with cookies keeps it from going stale.

**Edit** This seems to be happening in production, but not in my development environment.

Hmm... It appears the breadcrumbs for the final item is looking up the name of the object with its id in the parent table. i.e. `"Events/#{Event.find(@event.id).title}/Surveys/#{Event.find(@survey.id)}"`

**Edit** On further research, this does happen in other resource registers having the `belongs_to` relationship. Most of the time, the final breadcrumb in 'Edit' is the id of the object because no record with that id exists in the parent table. I don't think I have a single instance of it using the actual child resource's name in the edit breadcrumbs.

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

body:
I'm getting this issue in 0.6.2 as well.  Although with me it's manifesting with a draper message like the following (in case someone is googling):

```
PublicCourseDecorator#display_name delegated to object.display_name, but object is nil:
```

I tried putting the new code in `<app>/config/initializers/active_admin_monkey_patch.rb` and I can now get to the edit page however the menu is buggered now and now shows a single item for the current resource (which should never be in the menu).  The menu recovers when I to browse to any other page.

Any ideas on where to track that down?

Update:  There seem to be a couple of issues with belongs_to and menus.  I've created issue #2739
